column1: After a still winter night I awoke with the impression that some question had been put to me
column2: which I had been endeavoring in vain to answer in my sleep
column3: as what—how—when—where? But there was dawning Nature
column5: looking in at my broad windows with serene and satisfied face
column6: and no question on her lips. I awoke to an answered question
column7: to Nature and daylight. The snow lying deep on the earth dotted with young pines
column8: and the very slope of the hill on which my house is placed
column10: Forward! Nature puts no question and answers none which we mortals ask. She has long ago taken her resolution. "O Prince
column11: our eyes contemplate with admiration and transmit to the soul the wonderful and varied spectacle of this universe. The night veils without doubt a part of this glorious creation; but day comes to reveal to us this great work
column12: which extends from earth even into the plains of the ether."
